headline: My experience at Paytm
pros:
I am going to write some reasons why one should work at Paytm.

1. work culture is very nice
2. supportive employees 
3. opportunity to grow career 
4. Package too awesome
cons:
Cons:
I don't think there is any cons for working at Paytm.

headline: Horrible
pros: Salary, diversity and largest fun tech
cons:
Zero regards for work life balance. Operate 9 am to 10 pm and sometimes even 12 am. Not all disvisions but lending in specific.
They love pulling everyone in hours and hours of con calls even if you have work at hand and then expect work to be done in unrealistic timelines.
Wfh....your health will dwindle, no time to eat or digest .....no time to cook either.
Unable to get the work done even after that. More like class teacher and student relation. 
Zero authority to get work done, more sort of executioner. 
All this is after recent brass changes and additions.
Oh yes......high attrition of quality talent. They literally have to pull ppl from previous organisations.

headline: Awesome Place to Innovate , Experiment & Learn
pros:
It's been nearly 3 years working at Paytm and I must say that I have worked with the best minds of the industry to learn and grow in varied aspects. I started my jounrey as a Startup Program Manager, moved to working in E- Commerce as a Category Manager and now working with Senior Leadership team as Prgram Manager to work on Corporate Strategy. 

- Paytm is an ecosystem of diferent labs you can work in and the plethora of learning is immense. 
- One who has an entreprenuerial mindset, Paytm is a place to work.
- flat Hierarchy
- Seniors are all approachable and open to feedbacks.
cons:
- IF you are looking for 9-5 job , Paytm is definitely not a place to work.
- If you don't have speed , you can't survive.

headline: Smart people, Great environment very inclusive of everyone!
pros:
The fact that my work creates impact and helps to improve the product is very satisfying and rewarding. My Manager and colleagues are very supportive and encouraging. The Work life balance is good, There is no strict login timings, as far as the assigned work is done for the day you're good to do whatever you want. 

The onboarding process is very quick. I had fallen sick within 1 week of joining and I got a week off without any question or issues, which was very helpful for my recovery. 

In short great place to work, don't think twice or go on the reviews you read before, people sometimes only talk when they might have had a bad experience but there are many who have really good time working here and take my word for it!
cons: Can improve on their medical plans and other benefits. Apart from that none other that I can think of now.

headline: Very disappointed
pros: Some learnings are there. Else everything is a con.
cons:
1. Poor company polices. Such polices which make employees feel worst. No perks.
Policies are just to save company's costs.
Below industry pay. Too much disparity in compensation. 
2. Management means work. Literally too much work. Even on weekends they will make your life hell by assigning too much work.
3. No culture. No place for culture and values here. 
4. After leaving the company, the person is bothered too much about his own FNF money. Takes around 3 months to give the money. 
They cut unfair charges in FNF just to save some money for this unprofitable company out of employees hard earned money.
5. Poorest work life balance. They don't let you breathe in short.
6. No industry standards are followed. 
7. Employee happiness and well being comes at end in their lists. 
8. Worst place please don't join. Specially the one97 division.

headline: Improving work life balance. Great company to work with.
pros:
1. Fast paced environment.
2. Highly scalable systems which helps in developing the thinking of engineer, which makes the developer standout as compared to other competitor companies.
3. Work life balance is improving with some initiatives by management.
4. Tech Debt and Code Quality initiatives are one of the best initiatives, as they help in individual development.
5. Employees who are performing well, are being appreciated recently, which never used to happen in Paytm 4-5 months back.
cons:
1. No pay parity
2. Sometimes you need to work in off hours (mostly for prod issues, which is expected for a big company which values consumer experience over anything else)
3. Better planning and cross team coordination.

4. Paytm is building products based on what Razorpay, Cashfree and PayU are making rather than doing something of their own or focusing on what clients want
5. no internal sync between the teams, your internal peopl e only will irritate ur clients by reaching out with diff products before you know it has happened
6. They will mentally start harassing you if you're not good inn english/ speaking skills so that eventually you have to leave the company by yourself
7. No training given to employees when they join the org - you are expected to learn everythng on your own
8. bosses just fwd the mssgz they get from their bosses asking update abt your clients without figuring out the gaps

headline: Fast & Rewarding culture
pros: Paytm has a fast-moving culture, where you can experiment and deliver the experience to millions of customers. You need to be up and ahead in the game and have a customer-centric approach. Hard work is appreciated and rewarded. As an employee for over a decade, I can tell that the reward is far greater than expected.
cons: If you come with baggage or a preset notion of what's right and wrong, or a rigid process, then it will take you time to adjust.

All you can get out of being a mid level employee in paytm is disappointment
cons:
This comapny has no standards, they can change there own policy as and when they want no matter how controversial it is. 
When you leave they ask you to pay back 2 month salary and 18% GST on it and if you are late in paying back that they will start charging 18% interest on it.
No work culture, its either crappy grunt work or dissatisfying management.
The management fired around 50% of staff during the pandemic and tried to rehire them by giving less salary then they were making.
The upper management is selfish and will not think twice before stomping over your head for there own personal advancement. Its there culture.

headline: Learn and Innovate with speed competing against all Odds
pros:
Paytm provides one of the best learning environment which helps to acquire industry proven "Marketable skills".

Compensation at par or better than Industry parity and in a way one of the "Best Remuneration and ESOP program" to create wealth.

Peace of Mind- People who are giving their best are compensated with safety and rewarded by growing horizontally as well as vertically.

Opportunity to INNOVATE - An Indian Organization nurturing Indian talent to compete against world Leaders of Digital Innovation.

Speed- I am firm believer There are many who have ability, know their path to Grow but Paytm is one of the Unique who has speed too.

Few people may talk about work life balance - In my opinion Since we are growing exponentially and resolving some unsolved complex problems to make people's life easier, so to keep pace with change we need to speed up, which is actually our Organization's USP.
cons: * Exposure to overseas opportunities

headline: Fast-paced work environment with significant autonomy, and a flat structure
pros:
Significant scope of growth for the Fintech business in the next decade.

Heads of business units have complete autonomy to steer the direction based on their judgement, post the initial sign-off.
The only expectation is to grow faster than the market and generate revenues.

This autonomy for decision-making is addictive, and unlike any of my previous 'process driven' MNCs. 
It makes you feel like an entrepreneur despite being an employee. Also, the generous ESops are definitely a sweetener.
cons: Focussing on (and investing in) too many businesses simultaneously seems to be blocking management bandwidth

headline: Horrible Place to work
pros: The only pro I found was their well equipped office
cons: I had zero work life balance when I was working here. It took a toll on a physical and mental health. We worked for 13-14hrs everyday including weekends and holidays but still it was not enough for them and we were ill-treated all the time. People call at odd hours, off days and misbehave with you in the name of work. My mom was hospitalized and the day she was discharged I got a call from the Manager at 12 a.m. for a meeting. It is a very unethical company. It hires and fires as and when it likes and that too they do in bulk every month. Within 2months after I joined they said my role is not required anymore and then I was put into another team. If this did not happen, I would have lost my job within 2months. Do we leave our job and join here to be treated like this? My team and my managers were changed  6-7 times during my tenure. When we started WFH, we were asked to login at exactly 9:30 and there was no logout time. We were also asked to switch on our video and sit the whole day in front of the screen. What kind of nonsense was that? It was such a torture to work here.

headline: A career damaging company
pros:
-WFH in pandemic 
- A boost to your CV because of the Brand name
- Learn a thing or two about how to play politics or why boot licking is essential to earn a good position in the company
cons:
- One of the worst HR people I have met or interacted in my life - dont deserve to call them HR because they keep thier well-being in mind and not that of employees
- Old people specially in NCR region (mostly in HR) are only good at passing the buck, shunning off responsibilities on others, play favourites
- Capable people have no place in this company - it is all about how long you have spent here and your tenure is the your capability - doesnt matter if you dont know anything of your role or work here
- This company is run on the fingers of just one person (i dont need to name), no body has a say whatever the level: position-wise, intelligence-wise or EQ-wise.

headline: Worst Company to join
pros: This company is just for learning. If you want to learn join it, and leave as soon as you learnt the required skills.
cons:
1. This is the company which just knows to use employees as a Slave.
2. In Covid, the company announced publicly that all employees left their PL by their own wish, which was totally a lie. It just forcefully reset all the PL to zero, without asking, and everyone were enforced to accept the terms and condition.
3. After that fired all the employees having 1 or 2 rating in Apr 2020 (just after yearly review). 
4. Then they stretched the increment for remaining employees till November, and declared that they will not give any arrears. 
5. And, at the end given just single digit increment on the name of Covid.
6. Their ESOPs are just a lie (don't fall for that, they will not buy back any stocks when you will leave the company, so that is just a piece of paper for you.)

headline: Beware of Mental Health Crisis
pros: I still don't know any pros
cons:
- You will lose interest in what you do best.
- You will spend most of your time attending meetings or writing emails or thinking about why did you join this company.
- No learnings regarding tech
- You will learn how to code using email
- Even after leaving the company, they won't leave you and most probably you have to go through a lengthy & painful process of getting your full & final payment because they will deduct as much as possible in the name of assets recovery. Just a pro-tip if you joined, always keep all emails safe with you related to assets allocation and do not leave anything in the office, they won't be responsible for any lost assets and they will charge the cost of that assets from your fnf.

headline: Pathetic work culture
pros: Hardly any apart from brand value

1. Low package as per market standards with package not revised for years which is unacceptable 
2. Poor management and a lot of politics clearly visible in day to day working

4. Focus is more on quantity such as fixed timings rather than quality. Strict monitoring of time and I did not see people respecting each other
5. Casual leaves are way too less for someone to balance personal life as a result of which one has to take PLs . No sick leaves
6. Quality of work is not there atleast in my team
7. No incentives 
8. Workplace does not offer anything for employees to relax and food quality is just adding salt on wound

I would recommend specially freshers to think twice before joining

headline: Rampant and utter chaos, politics, incompetence and faff
pros: The pay. Literally nothing else. You get overpaid for the most invaluable work, especially if you have an IIM degree.
cons:
1. The leaders are overhyped internal gods who climbed up the ladder purely because they are a tad bit smarter and savvier than the rest, and knew how to talk their way through. These leaders would not survive elsewhere at a place where talent and meritocracy are norms. 
2. This is the quintessential nepotist company where friends, family and blood is promoted and given better opportunities by virtue of relationships. Meritocracy is absent altogether 
3. There is no learning coz your boss likely does not know much more than you. The basics of Human Resource’s are alien in this organisation. Reporting structures are arbitrary, based on neither experience or talent differential. 
4. Pay is outright unfair. As an IIM grad I got paid 2X-3X for the same job a non IIM grad performed. 
5. There is no training or development that helps employees develop or improve their skill set. Talking is the lone skill set most people in this organisation have
6. There is rampant sexism, derogatory jokes about women when the boys get together for drinks etc 
7. People in sales misuse travel approvals to claim unreasonable expenses. On the flip side, the company does not offer approval budgets that even cover basic accommodation in expensive cities forcing you to pull. 24 hour day to travel and return the same day. 
8. Leaders bark at employees like they’re somehow entitled to do so. 
9. Oh how could I forget the ++ culture. You send a mail to someone requesting something you need, and each person will tag someone else into the mail with a +. The ++ can go on to 20-30 people within a day, after a while you realise you can never get a single thing done without escalating to a persons leader, or doing someone else’s job yourself. Accountability and ownership are not in the vocabulary of this organisation.

The best thing I ever did for myself was to leave Paytm.

headline: Worst Organization
author_position: Senior Software Development Engineer In Test
pros: New cutting edge tech stack
cons:
1. Daily minimum 12 hours working. Even work on weekends.
2. Can wake you up in late night and ask you to login
3. Management is barbaric.
4. Worst organization

headline: Work depends on the team you are being hired for
pros:
1. Some teams are doing amazing stuff
2. Work culture is not very formal and process based. Work speed/pace is good
3. You get to interact more across teams. If you are keen, you can pick up some learnings here.
4. Few folks are highly talented. If you have good fortune, you'll come across them/work alongside them.
5. Good place for freshers to get initial learning.
6. Good scope of learning for Web/JS developers
7. Good package if you are holding an existing good offer.
8. Some people here are quite genuine. People who'll actually have concern for you as a person.
cons:
This will be long. So hang on...

Web/Javascript Developers: Learning scope is good. You get to work in making hybrid frameworks and hybrid flows and learn a decent amount. Work pressure will be quite high.

App Developers: Very less technical growth for app developers in the Paytm Consumer app (They Paytm money app however has good scope for app developers though). The development process is is more focused on hurriedly completing features and not on making the native flows more sleek. New experimental stuff is just talked about and implemented in quite rare cases. Work pressure will be high.

BE developers: Technical growth depends on the team you are being hired for. Some teams do good work. Others do pretty much mediocre work. Work pressure also varies across teams

QA: Again technical growth depends on teams. Automation is handled by few select teams and a few select folks. Do inquire about the nature of your work from your HM before joining. (Although even your HM's words won't be a guarantee). Work pressure depends on teams, but is generally on the higher end.

Teams based out of Noida mostly focus on getting work done faster and that usually requires stretching beyond work hours in a good deal of sprints.

I would have given a 3 rating but here are the reasons I made it 2...

The company has punch in/punch out policy of 9 hours. HRs may escalate to your managers if your hours are low. Escalations might also happen if you have worked beyond office hours a lot for the previous month and are clocking lesser hours this month. But ultimately your manager can stand for you (if he/she chooses to) and defend your timings.

Company does not have much employee benefits

HR dept is non-cooperative. Even something as simple as requesting an address proof certificate does not get obliged. Any queries from the HR dept does not get answered in due time.

The company also has some weird IT policies wherein employees have to pay in some of the cases in case of any issue with their office laptops. I know of other companies where employees do not have to pay for similar issues with their laptops.

While moving out the company deducts recovery amounts from your salary if you are serving time lesser than your notice period. NOTE THAT THIS WILL HAPPEN EVEN IF YOUR MANAGER APPROVES TO LET YOU LEAVE BEFORE YOUR STIPULATED NOTICE PERIOD. The HR dept does not inform about such deductions and you get to know about it only after you get your final settlement. There will be no intimation about this anytime anywhere before the final settlement mail reaches you (which will generally be 1-2 months after you leave). You'll have no idea that they are going to deduce recovery amount from your salary before the final settlement.

headline: Good to learn but poor for growth

Also there are no perks, on Diwali they don't have any bonus and all, they will give a Haldiram to you and that's it. Cafeteria is the worst. And no matter how hard you work, they will give you 5% appraisal.

headline: No value for employees, poor management
pros:
Good brand name. 
You can get call from good companies when you looking for change from here.
cons:
1 Need to work on almost every weekend. 
2 It's your manager who decide the eta of the task(who even do not know a single point about the task) and mostly they calculate it according to 10-11 hours for each working day and 7-8 hour for each weekend day.  You may need to work on 2-3 weekend here. Even some national holidays are also working day here for me. 
3 Totally Manager oriented organization. So good appraisal depends on relation with manager not on your work. 
4 HR are so busy they only call once or hardly twice in a year. If you discuss any issue related to your team or management with them , then they call to management  and disclose all your conversation and your name with them. After that manager have the right to fire you from organization.

headline: One of the worst companies ever for engineers
pros:
There are none, ZERO, Absolutely negative! Word of advice is not to join this ugly company at all.
This company is only good for people who are not interested in working or have already given up their dreams.
cons:
- Worse management. Lets me start from a technical perspective first. First of all they have no work ethics. This company's culture is bad because right from the top its ugly starting from VSS (Vijay Shekhar Sharma)
- There is no DEVOPS culture.. or you can say there is no culture in general.
- The Program managers are basically bunch of monkeys who are like 5th grade teacher asking "how many days can you get this done" . like seriously?
- I worked for a team called DAAS (data as a service) worst team ever. too much internal politics and obviously no sense of work
- Sanjay Singh was the VP when i was there, and obviously this guy has 0 knowledge of anything.. apart from the shity startup he sold to lick VSS downsides

headline: Try to avoid joining this company.
pros:
1. Industry standard compensation.
2. You get to work on large scale applications.
cons:
1. No vision for the future, every task is to be done to solve an immediate problem of which there is a high count.
2. No work/life balance. Employees are expected to work 24x7.
3. Bad management- Most of the time employees do not know why they are working on something, neither does the management.
4. SDLC is not followed properly. Managers are more interested in getting the things done quickly rather than doing them the right way resulting in very bad coding practise. 
5. Hostile working environment - people have no idea how to communicate in a professional environment.
6. Bad location for the office.
7. Leaves and pay hikes are considered a favour on the employees and can be taken away/cancelled at any time.
8. Since work is not done properly, most of the SEs' time is spent on fixing issues rather than creating something new.

headline: Genuine Feedback | Very unhealthy company for Techies
pros:
Company stability.
Not much work to do.
Good brand value.
cons:
No new tech learnings. 
No motivation, no proper rewards and recognition of your hard work.
Not employee friendly, they will change your complete team, reporting at any time without any notice given to you, But if you want to change your team or location for any reason, you will get nothing or in some cases u will be fired.
They hold increments for more than 5 months.

No proper feedback process.
Last year’s feedback is not provided, and they will ask to fill KRAs for next year... without knowing your weaknesses, strengths from last year, how you can set target for next year.

headline: Worst Company to work For - Doesn't care about it's employee at all.
pros: 1. Free mental torture and highly unprofessional environment.
cons:
1. The work culture is very very unprofessional, you can clearly hear, people (including managers also ) abusing, you will get to know about this for sure in a single week.
2. No manager & employee relation, I have my self heard my manager abusing one of my teammates, and have heard stories of a complete team getting abused in meeting room, just because there was a bug in production.
3. Very very short projects, Max 2 weeks.
4. Illogical work pressure.
5. No work-life balance at all, Employees made to work for at least 12-14 hours a day, and managers don't even think before calling you at 11-12 pm and on weekends, and that is very very regular (IN Corona WFH).
6. Politics, that is clearly visible in teams.
7. Any complaints to HR is useless.
8. The company doesn't care for its employees. Company pressuring employees to join the office even in the corona. 
9. There is always a feeling of job insecurity.
10. You will always get a feeling that if you're going to complain about any genuine issue to HR, It is going to work against you.
11. If you don't have life or you want to make your life hell, then only join this company, till the time It was my worst career decision to join this company.
12. Take these cons seriously, I have committed a huge mistake of not taking glassdoor reviews seriously.

headline: Not for growth seekers. The company is not employee-centric at all.
pros:
A few good things about Paytm are - 
1. Salary is always on time
2. For any paperwork you have portals 
3. Infrastructure is good online and offline
cons:
This list is rather long - 
1. There is a scolding/yelling culture. This practice is extremely normalized.
2. There is a lack of EQ in managers, heads, and leads. They are either not experts at what they do or too stiff to admit they don’t know any better.
3. There is bias. The culture of Clique thrives here. If you are an alumnus of the same college then you 'll be treated differently, same case is if you are from a common former employer.
4. Very toxic workplace. Within teams, they aren't inclusive when it comes to variety. The managers restrict if you try to experiment with something new ( because in some domain such as marketing you can't keep doing what's conventional)
5. There is no review system, no grievance, HRs don't get in touch with you to check-in.
6. Micromanagement is an issue. Consistent check-ins of your whereabouts for which Informal Whatsapp groups are made to check-in even if you are out for lunch break.
7. This isn't an employee-centric company. It thrives on what employees have created so far but fails to take care of them. So much so for the Linkedin branding but there is not an exhaustive process that makes sure that employees feel safe mentally - mental harassment is a thing. Higher management has no polite system to give feedback.
8. There is not employee engagement. Seems like a dud. Salary is the only motivation.

headline: Don't join unless you're desperate
pros:
If you're coming from a good product based company, you'll be doing better than most of the folks having double your experience, so not much to learn. Also, comparatively, you'll perform well in the team, which will give you more appraisal (not necessarily any growth in career)

It is possible to get a good hike at the time of joining (depends on how you negotiate) as well as during appraisals (if you have good relations with your manager and HOD both)
cons:
Not employee friendly - Paytm only cares about their business and their own profits, doesn't bother whether you're sick or your health is being affected.

Policies are broken - Starting from offer letter to WFH policies to leave policies to FnF settlement, nothing is well defined. They'll twist their own words at their will.

Worst IT assets policy - First of all, you'll never get the laptops which gets your work done easily, instead, you'll get the laptop based on your level and time of stay in the company. Exceptions are there for some teams. Secondly, you'll also get charged for minor scratches/cracks while returning the laptop.

No focus on employee learning/growth - No benefits if you stay here long; Your growth will stagnate, you won't learn much, not possible to gain insights or deep dive into any technology given the pressure of work, most of which is ad-hoc. No access to any learning portal or certifications whatsoever.

Pay parity - they pay as per your experience in the industry, no matter your skills or relevance to the job role. There could be a huge pay parity between two people having the exact same responsibilities, just because of the seniority.

Corrupt rewards and recognition program - You'll find a few teams where every member gets an award no matter what they did, and some teams where saving even $1 million per month wouldn't be appreciated.

Late appraisals - Appraisal cycle is Jan-Dec. Reviews start from Jan/Feb, but appraisals usually happen around Jun-Jul, though pending arrear from April is paid altogether.

Poor benefits - Medical insurance and referral amount too low. Not enough parking for cars, a little better situation for two wheelers. Majority of the employees park outside, which is expensive/risky. No course/certifications reimbursements as well.

headline: Not a tech focus company
pros: It has a startup culture and if you join as a fresher or maybe within 2 to 3 years of experience it will be a great learning experience for you. You might get hands on idea of many recent open source technologies which will be a big plus point. You will gain confidence on working on large scale system (to some extent). But there it ends. Once you have spent maximum 1.5 to 2 years, you need to run from there. Why ? I will mention in cons
cons:
Paytm Payment bank is not a tech focused company.They just care about making things work somehow in short term even at the cost of long term failure. Sometimes around the completion you get to know that things are not gonna work. Even if you wanted to raise a voice in early stage nobody cares. All the management cares about to dance at the Wim of one man, you know who. Nobody cares how good developer you are. Since there is no respect to tech so no respect to developers. Senior people are not good at tech in fact once you become lead you are supposed to be a manager not a technical person.
If you join as a lead/EM you will get lot of resistance from other EM/Lead. They don’t want to share knowledge because they feel they will loose their value and nothing is documented. SO you are doomed. You will feel lack of planning all over the place. Office will be like fish market. I don’t know how the hell people think that a developer can work in such an environment. Product, QA, your manager sometimes people from business will be sitting on your head all the day long.

headline: Don't even think of joining
pros: Salary is good for freshers for IITs.
cons:
1) If you are selected for paytm payment don't even think of joining.
2) Extreme level  micro management. 
3) Manager loves boot licker.
4) From SE->SSE it would take 3 years or more but for boot lickers will be promoted form SSE->TL in 1 year, considering they have become SSE in last appraisal.
5) TL level people are not even able to solve basic doubts of java.
6) Manager and TL are business centric. (Sometimes I think what that "Engineering" and "Tech." in their position stands for).
7) Company and management consider employees just as resource rather than human.
8) Compulsory to complete 9 hours(but they expect you to work on home :P).
9) Rate of resignation is very high (In my team there is always 2-3 people serving notice period at any point from past one year).
10) Standards of interview is very low leading to bad quality of engineers.
11) A QA from adobe is leading one of the biggest team of payments paytm.

headline: Micro Management | worst culture
pros:
Opportunity to learn Kibana :P
Opportunity to work in the AliPay code base.
cons:
- Managers don't know how to manage a tech team. They behave line contactor and treat employees as labour.
- Ask employee to complete 10days task in 2 days. And if its break on the production they will ask for RCA.
- The manager keeps track of every hour you spend in the office, forces to stay for a minimum of 9 hours in the office. Also, ask to work at nights and on the weekend.
- The manager changes the seating plan and also forces to sit accordingly.
- Every year team changes(people resign) but the manager stays in the company. 
- Higher Management (HR, Founder) is ignoring all this. 
- HR and Manager do not pick phone calls when needed.

Example
A bug fix which can solve 1000's customer issue would be deprioritized if there is one customer escalation came from boss 

4) Top minus One level leadership is too week to handle the scale and remain market leader. NoReal mentor exist

headline: Worst Management(Micro management), HR, Admin, Cafeteria (basically everything)
pros: Gupta ji's Samosa near the building are good. informal clothes are allowed all days.  Yeah I think that is it.
cons:
Let's start 
1) Management is very bad. Micro-Management is one thing, here managers have gone for Nano Micro Management. They will track every minute of your time.  In some time even Bathroom breaks will be timed.  

2) You have to complete 9 hours each day. Even though they do not have tasks for you. And even after completing 9 hours you are expected to be available 24*7, weekends and nights are all working basically.

3) They treat employees like slaves, if you are the favourite of your EM only then you will get everything otherwise you wont get any promotions or appraisals.

4) Best company for BootLickers as they can get promotions and appraisals without any talent or performance. people with 2 years experience are Senior Engineer here and 3-4 years experienced bootlickers can become Tech Leads. I think people with QA background can also become Senior Tech Lead.

5) HR and admins are the worst, let alone employees, they wont even treat you like human beings. They wont reply to the mails , wont pick up the calls or reply msgs. None of your queries get resolved. Sometimes we feel like even if we are standing in from they will act like they cant even see us.

6) Cafeteria is the biggest disappointment here. There are rats running around in cafeteria. There is no coffee machine in the CAFETERIA. Food is 3rd grade, and costs even more than the market price.

7)Their buildings are worst, 10 people sit on space which is meant for 5. Lifts never work, they are always under maintenance. You will never find a parking spot even if you come early. 

8) They tell you that you will have 2 months notice period but they can update it to 3 months, if you opt for going to a Foreign Country (You know which country it is) for "training" (not really!), they will ask you to serve 3 months of notice for going to a country for their own work.

9) They will say that their appraisal is done in April but the letter comes in August.

headline: Good for learning and brand name. Not for culture
pros:
The learning opportunity is good in most of the teams, especially for freshers.
The work is fast-paced and you might get a chance to own your product end to end.
Brand name of Paytm is good.
cons:
The behavior of some managers. It trickles down from the top. The CEO treats everyone as inferior and that culture just trickles down.
If you want to be in good books, be ready to sacrifice work-life balance.
You might not get appreciated for the work you do, because of the politics and power structure.
The constant power tussle between upper management is giving un-stability to the company.
There is no effort to keep employees happy and retain them. They will hire new people when you leave.
The average retention time is less than a year! There are just new people everywhere.
Completely money-oriented company. The only mantra of higher management is to make money with no focus on product quality.

headline: Software engineer
pros:
Flexible work timings for old employees
It’s a good company for those who can do buttering of the seniors
Since it’s the parent company of paytm recruiters can’t make any difference between the two due to which employees gets placement calls from good companies
cons:
No process is followed while stating the requirements. Everything is told verbally and the whole project gets scrapped due to changing requirements.
No value is given to the person who is performing well. 
One on one doesn’t happen for performance appraisal and nobody takes any pain to read the employees’ contributions for the organisation instead we got increament letters directly without any discussion
Everybody gets the same average appraisal which is why people don’t stay here for longer duration
Cafeteria is made in parking lot, sometimes you can’t really have anything because of the smell that comes from sewer pipelines
Office location isn’t good
Employees don’t get a feeling of working in mnc.
There is no professionalism here. Get ready to hear personal comments from individuals working in here

headline: Pathetic work culture
pros: - Good learning opportunities for developers. Company encourages use of open source, mindset to adopt latest technologies, in short - do whatever you can , just get the job done.
cons:
- Plethora of Politics. There is favouritism, people trying to cave their way in via some influential managers inside company, and every other sort of politics you can imagine.
- Middle management is literally the worst I have seen or heard of. There are managers who do nothing than berate people. Imagine a manager who has no idea of the inner workings of a project, always using a stick approach to get the job done, never giving credit. Many managers say even company CEO Vijay almost abuses them in meetings. UNPROFESSIONAL.  
- This place is more chaotic than a hurricane. They have no idea what they will do in next 15 days. Projects come and go like seasons. Employees are transferred from one sister company to another (One97 - paytm - paytmBank - Paytm Mall). You may be working on something super critical, only to come in next day and know that project is scrapped.
- Talk about employee perks - NIL. Benefits ? Negative. Employees do not even have proper seats to sit. There is huge space crunch. You leave your seat to go to the washroom, there is a 90% probability you're not getting it when u return. There have been fights between people over seating issues.
- You will almost certainly NOT get a seat in cafeteria if you want to have lunch on proper timings, it is over crowded, always.
- Parking is huge problem. Office is at very busy location in sector 2 Noida, you will never ever get to park in the office premises, there are only a limited number of spaces available. Only if you reach office before 9, you may get lucky. Otherwise you have to find a spot in local streets (very difficult), where your vehicle can be towed away anytime.
- HR is just a name here. It is absolutely useless. you make a referral ? HR will not reply. You have an issue with manager? - HR can do nothing about it.

headline: Fraud Organization
pros:
You must enter at least 5 words for Pros.
This what glass-door suggested to do and reply is Not a single Pros
cons:
1. Worst organisation,  not employee centric organisation.
2. Recruiters throws random lies just to hire a candidate.  Work is done from scratch, your resume will groomed up. But worst coding is done. Nothing is done from scratch just play with if and else and look after production issues due to random fixes deployed without any testing.
 3. Mental torturing done by leads to sit for more hours, abusive words by manager, leader and product.
4. Pay lavish party to manger on joining and on leaving
5. Worst management, worst leaders, no mentors, gender biased organisation where manager and leaders openly abuse that girls are not fit for coding.
6. HR donot take any action just ask to change the team or look for a switch.
7. Second hand broken laptops are given later they charge an amount that you did harm to laptop.
8. This organisation charge service tax to candidate for buy out amount or early release amount.
9. Paytm culture is toxic, abusive and fake.
10. No good increments at all, inspite favouritism works.

headline: Totalitarian Management, fictitious HR & frivolous employees
pros:
1.) One can easily get promoted by simply sucking up to his or her manager.
2.) Get salary hikes by getting an offer from another company. Every unscrupulous person has reaped the benefit of this virus plaguing the team culture.
cons:
1.) Innovation is frowned upon. Operations intensive company.
2.) No long term focus. Most of the tasks are taken over to meet short term goals only.
3.) No dedicated HR team. Employees working for Talent Acquisition are working as HR BP (business practices).

headline: Paytm Payments: Graveyard for Tech Guys
pros:
I am strictly talking about the Tech Payment Gateway (PG) team here.
There aren't many pros that come to mind, few are:

1) Even if you are not good at technical implementation, but you can talk effectively and impress people in a discussion (design or product discussion). Then you can make very good career here, cause mostly these people just talk. Very little work is actually done here.

2) If you can keep your managers happy(not by work, mind you) and your manager is a powerful person within the hierarchy you will enjoy good appraisals/promotion etc.

3) You are  not only evaluated on your Tech capability, but also on how much in sync you are with your manager.
cons:
The list is endless:

1) The tech stack is pathetic, you will actually feel you skills deteriorating after working here for more than a year.

2) Half of the payments team work on Alibaba's platform which uses age old legacy tech and still on java 6 (yes thats right). There are no open source  frameworks used in platform.

3) IF you have more than 3-4 year of industry experience, absolutely stay away from here.

4) The work hours will be long and you might be expected to stay late even if you come in early. if you leave before 7:30 PM your manager will have a talk with you. doesn't matter if you come in early.

5) they call anytime during night to fix stupid issues which can wait till next morning.

6) The projects started rarely finish here, and most of the time you will be switched to some other work, before completing the previous one. 

7) Expectations from Tech Leads is that they will look into several project's management and also work as an individual contributer. Mostly end up burned out and leave.

8) Highly minial jobs like log analysis is give to less experienced folks and they get frustrated due to lack of coding exposure.

9) If a guy is working very well, he will not here any appreciation. But if his performance lacks even for one week (doesn't matter due to personal reason or what), someone will come and have a talk with you.

10) Constant micromanagement.

11) Employees are treated as naukars, even for a small expense approval you might have to beg to many senior people. I had to go to CTO for a 4000/- Rs. approval once.

I can go endlessly here... guys make a smart choice and stay away. 

They throw money to lure you in and then make your life miserable. No amount of money is worth the suffering.

headline: Award:- Worst place to work, Only consider if you hate yourself
pros: Brand name (not sure how long that'd sustain)
cons:
This is the worst company with devastating culture and no respect for its employees.
- a lala company to its core with a founder (Mr. VSS) who thinks too highly of himself and is total showoff
- no respect given to employees. VSS regularly shouts at and abuses others and thinks everyone working at Paytm is his slave. Because of him the whole company's culture is like that as others follow his example too.
There are many more examples of how people are disrepected here but I'd not go into details.
- total micro-management by VSS and no decision making power with others. He even decides which coffee machine should be kept in the cafetaria, ha!
- blatant favouritism - VSS has a few that he likes and only those get all major projects, out of the line promotions and huge pay hikes. Likeness in VSS's books and not your work defines your graph at Paytm. Consequently, if he gets to dislike you, you're asked to leave and not report to office from next day.
-  No clarity and stability - Teams are changed frequently at VSS and management's whims and fancies with no regard to employee's wish or his experience. I've even seen Designers being asked to do Operations and HRs being made product managers.
- Anti-employee rules - HR rules are so anti-employee that you can't even imagine. There is even a clause that empowers the company to fire you for ANY CAUSE without any notice.
- Work is depressing to say the least. Everyone is just towing the line and has no clarity on what needs to be done.
- No sick leaves - if you get sick, poor you! Please avail off your casual and paid leaves.
- Different facilities and treatment based on your position and clout in the company

headline: Bad company.

Very bad company to work.
Upper management got hired when no one was willing to join the company. Upper management is in-competent and untechnical. They are good at one thing politics. Even if you try to make them understand something they take it as your negative calling you being acting oversmart. Projects are developed and scrapped which they call bcs of startup environment, but which is a failure on upper management side as no startup can afford scrapped projects. No technical learning. Don't  get fooled by there user base count as they have solved very good problems in worst possible ways and are not willing to change. Bad food in canteen. Poor sitting chairs. Stinking washrooms. Noida office has huge odc feels like sitting in a fish market. No proper sitting arrangements. Anything you can think from a normal product based company is not here.

headline: Go big or Go home
pros:
- Visibility of good work
- Unlimited opportunities of growth
- No boundary culture
- Subsidised food
- Next to Delhi, hence easy commute using public transport
- No pampering, only performance assessment
- Green office environment
- Happening place
- Tech stack is getting stronger everyday
- Only place in NCR region where you can do miracles and get noticed
- Startup culture for growth

I have been working in Paytm for almost 2 years now and enjoying every bit of it. Every company is different and so is Paytm. If you want to live a retired life, look somewhere else. If you have been spoiled by MNC's process oriented culture, look somewhere else. If you are looking for a job where work-life balance means 9-5 job, look somewhere else. If you want to be on rapid growth path, paytm is the place. If you want to upskill yourself, paytm is the place. If you have an idea which is not getting environment to sprout and become a product, come to paytm. If you have the fire to go beyond, look at paytm. It lives on "Go big or Go home" fundamental.
cons:
- HR can do a better job by introducing employee friendly policies
- Admin team can do a better job and arrange more place to work
- Some of the things in tech can be more systematic
- Some procurement processes can be made little faster. It hurts only the organisation, not any individual.

headline: Stable company but no career growth
pros:
- Stable job
- Provides good salary but not best
- No work pressure
- Flexible timing
- My manager is very good not sure about others
- Every employees gets amount quarterly for team outing
cons:
- No carrer groth and new learning
- Still using old technologies
- It is not process oriented company
- HR, Finance etc. are not reachable. They  don't care to your email. They don't even reply after taking follow up. It's very embarrassing. Very serious issue,need improvement.
- No cab from/to home. You will only get metro shuttle from sector 15 metro station.
- Cafeteria (lunch vendor) is very bad. They serves tasteless food since last 5 days.
- Not using project management tools like JIRA, you will get requirements either verbally or in email.
- No clear rule for promotion, few employees are working as Technical Lead and few employees of same experience are working as Manager.
- Last appraisal, all employees got same percent of appraisal regardless of their performance.

headline: Do not join Paytm
pros:
Salary is credited on time.
Some colleagues are supportive.
cons:
No work life balance.
No process for work is defined.
No one is supportive neither leads nor team managers.
New joiners are treated badly by team members.(related to work culture)
Leads are only there to assign tasks. Leads don't take the responsibility.
Favoritism in the teams.
Persons who are quite close to managers get very good appraisals.
Persons who give drinks party to managers also get good appraisals.
Leads can't forward their team members' issues to higher authorities.
Managers mentally harass team members by ordering them to stay late even though there is nothing high priority work, can be done tomorrow.
Persons who are quite close to managers have no time boundation, they can come and go at any time.

headline: One of the worst place to work
pros: freedom to work at your pace sometimes.
cons:
Paytm is one of the worst places to work.

Many people live in fear in Paytm of being abused verbally by the top leadership.
Some people behave entitled asking others to get their breakfast and so on.
Work style is one of the worst I have seen in the industry.

When it comes to team, it's filled with gossip mongering, abusive people.

And coming to biz issues, Paytm takes a 'make money at all costs' approach. 'Only 10% of the people actually use cash back. We can use it to deceive people' is one of the common attitudes from the top management.

Fear, greed and entitlement and abuse are present in huge quantities in Paytm work atmosphere which can get hostile and toxic.

Working in Paytm can cause you sleepless nightmares. As much as possible avoid working in Paytm.

headline: The worst ever people you will ever find in any company.
pros: No work at all. So if you want to chill out and get time off to clear more interviews this is the place to be. Just make sure you dont get frustrated by the wrong doing of the dumb crowd here.
cons:
Many.
1. No work from home. 
2. No respect for work but discipline. You are supposed to complete your 8-9 hours in office irrespective of you do any work or not. 
3. Highly pathetic management, political in nature. They may even stop you from doing right work as they themselves are highly dumb when it comes to technical capabilities. 
4. They have the worst ever policies. 
5. The laptops, office internet are pathetic. And all the manager will do is say to mail the IT and keep doing it till the problem is resolved. Not sure if we come to work or do this crap. 
6. Nothing to learn as we are not scaling the stuff. Its all done by Alibaba, So if you are a developer who loves or would love to work on scale, do not go by the name that they have more than 200 million users.

headline: About Company and Culture
pros:
1. Paytm is a growing platform.
2. Pay and package is quit good. 
3. It created a very good brand within few years.
cons:
Many cons we have experienced dont know which to say, trying to focus on imp onces.
1. Worst work culture. ( especially at east office )
2. U will not get respect if u do not participate in oiling competition.
3. If you are a off - roll employee they will treat u as a labour of a construction site. Some times like a dog also. 
4. Your profile and job responsibility will change every 3 months with out explaining and discussing with you. 
5. On- roll experience employees can not focus on a fix job profile. 
6. Incentive structure is very low and keeps on changing even varies from employee's attitude and according to your work. 
7. HR is worth less, that department is only for management, employees will not get any help from HR.
7. This company is good for freshers not for experience employees.

headline: avoid working here
pros: growing company, lots of media buzz
cons:
No logic works. Only his command. No argument works, only his anger and tantrums. If you write him emails, he expects you to talk to him in person. If you walk up in person, he is not available.
If you dont get his approval over something, he shouts. If you don't wait for his approval but start the work, he shouts. He wants to control everything. Right from what to strategize to who sits on which chair. He has team but is afraid of delegating. His closer people get far too many responsibilities and then they dont do justice to any. Imagine such a big company having one person managing both business and product. None gets attention.

headline: Nice company to work in

If you want to learn how a company functions as a whole you need to work here.

cons:
Heavy Politics present here. A former DGM of a department upon joining hired all the assistant managers and team leaders of his previous organisation and left much less scope for internal promotions. 

Inspite of having 4 buildings in 2 sectors it lacks accommodating it's employees. Be prepared to work without AC during summers on few days.

I coined a new term here and that's VSSlicking. Owner of the company is referred as VSS and managers and higher management of this company have a penchant for going that extra mile ball licking him over emails.

headline: Hopeless company. Only buttering. No work. Uninspiring HODs!
pros: Salary on time. That is it.
cons:
1. HODs are incompetent. They are just their as they have been there for a long time and have been YES MEN to the promoter.
2. The Owner only speaks to HODs and rest all are irrelevant in the organisation.  Nobody dares say no to the CEO,
3. Strategy changes every week and departments change every week. Musical chairs happens with the HODs.
4. Work is uninspiring. Most of it is usually trashed by next week when departments change. there is no clarity of vision and where the organisation wants to go. 
5. Every business transaction is in negative margin. And it appears they want it that way. Every HOD thinks up of ways how to use the most money.
6. The promoter spends all day giving interviews to the media. The internal buzz is that we are a PR company in the app business. Then after a week he does a review and some heads are cut.
7. HR policies are non existent. Hire and Fire rules.Highly overstaffed after they got funding. Have witnessed 100 people been fired in one day.

headline: High On Mediocrity,  Random Work,  OK Work Culture
pros:
1. Good Salary and Reimbursement. 
2. Lot of learnings for freshers and mid level individuals. 
3. Young and Vibrant People. 
4. Some managers are very talented and we can learn a lot from them. 
5. Vijay has a very good vision for company.
cons:
1. Random Work. Can be asked to work on anything at any time. 
2. Very poor work environment. Not at all professional environment. 
3. Start up culture might not suit everyone. 
4. Can be asked to work on weekends depending on the team you work in. 
5. Some teams have very less work and some have a lot of work. 
6. Some talented people are overloaded with work and hence leave eventually. 
7. Manager driven company and hence if you mess up with him/her you will have a tough time. 
8. Office politics. People try to save themselves at expense of others.

headline: If you are talented, don't fall for the media hype and investor money
pros: Jump in and find out for yourself. In the end, you will definitely come out wiser.
cons: Professionalism, respect and dignity are alien concepts. If you are a relative of the CEO or somebody close to him, or a pretty face, it makes a difference. Otherwise, they need people for increasing the headcount. To fool the investor that its a growing company and get funded. Even  after 15 years they claim to be startup. No processes. They will give you a good hike at the time of hiring and then you are at their mercy, can make or break your career. Have summarily dismissed many CFO's, CHRO's in the past. Micro managed - one man show.

headline: Pretty good place to work
pros:
I am not gonna slate the pros and cons thing but I'll share my experience so far. It's been 7 months here and what all I have to say will surely be a neutral approach.

1. I come to office around 10 or 11 at times and leave by 5. Flexible hours you see.
2. Work load is constant across every industry and i feel pity for those who say no work load. If that's the thing then I guess your company isn't doing any business. However, over here, smart approach is an applied science. We work hard and party harder!
3. There's nothing like Hierarchy! Strange isn't it! Well, what if i tell you that i had share a cup of tea with the CEO of the company just on the second week of joining. 
4. If you are creative, keep your workstation untidy and pin as many posters as you want to. 
5. Ain't satisfied with your work, talk to your Managers and they'll make sure they welcome your ideas and execute them.
6. Inexpensive food in mess. I mean where would you get a buffet platter at just 35. Though the food isn't that swanky delicious but yeah in a way it's pretty fine and yes, HYGIENIC.

I can go on bragging about it for I haven't had a bad hair day ever since 200 days or working. But just in case if things turn out weird, you'd see me posting again. :D
cons:
1. Your team members might not be that creative like you are and they might just silently talk behind your back about you too making an allied with TLs and other cliche people.

That's just one. You're right!

headline: Great working environment and learnings in Paytm
pros:
Have joined 2 years back and it has been a roller coaster ride with full of learning’s and great technology work with team.  You will get all appreciations and rewards for your hard work. 
Good compensation.
Work on advance technology 
Performance driven culture
You can speak and reach out to any one in the organization for help and support. Not a designation or hierarchical approach in the company.
cons: More colourful cafeteria. Company should now build own campus.

headline: I shouldn't have left at all!
pros: There is so much in life that counts - a lesson I have learnt AFTER leaving Paytm. If I had not been so swayed at that moment, I would have been enjoying these: a super friendly environment! We could just think up anything - whether related to work, or an event that we wanted held, which I term as extra-curricular activities - and just go ahead an do it! We were always encouraged. At anytime during my 2 year stay, I never felt that my designation mattered. If in a meeting I would suggest an idea, I would get as much credit for it as a senior would get. I miss these things now.
cons: Well, I think sometimes the company moves with such a speed that people are left without the knowledge of what's happening or where they are heading. By the time the management addresses the people, things have moved even further ahead.

headline: Good for fresher but not for long stay
pros:
Its good workplace to start career as Software Engineer.
Due to hectic work load and rigorous changes in requirements one needs to be quick in accepting challenges and implementing the same.
cons:
No software development life-cycle is followed.
Favoritism is there.

headline: Worst place to work at Paytm. No respect for individuals and absolute top down approach for doing everything.
pros: Company has a great potential for growth being in this industry.
cons:
No personal life. Weekend is not holiday but work from home.
No respect for employees contributions.
Structure and processes in engineering are non existent.

Should be the last option for anyone considering and is best avoided.

HR is helpless and decision making is very absurd.

headline: aesome place to be
pros: One97 Communications Ltd. is India's leading mobile-internet company . Driven by great consumer experience, it offers digital goods & services to mobile consumers under Paytm brand. One97 also provides mobile mobile advertising, marketing and payments for merchants.
cons:
politics ! 
highly competitive people around at times

headline: Great learning environment
pros: Good compensation, good learning environment
cons: No work culture. Eat sleep work repeat.

headline: One97 - Rating - Poor - Avoid at all costs, even if its the only option, you will be better unemployed.
pros: Personal growth for people who know how to please the management and they need not be qualified and most of them are not. Have risen only on the basis of their loyalty to the ceo, people who can't even get a receptionist's job in the market - can be found here designated as VP. Nothing professional about the organisation.
cons: immature management, no transparency, nothing professional about the company, its a one man show, no job security, if you want to ruin your career, just go ahead and join. Unjust and arbitrary action, no reason. Pays media to always be in the news - always hiring, but they don't tell you how many they fire without any rhyme or reason. they want people who are not smart and don't have a mind of their own. Ceo thinks he has got all the brains in the world, very shrewd and cunning. His younger brother is two steps ahead of him. He heads a function, otherwise not qualified or polished enough - even to get a job somewhere else.This company has made money from malpractices by bribing people at telecom operator end, and by forcefully deducting money from prepaid balance of the users. No morals - pimps. Believe in promoting their own.

headline: Its like working in a diamond mine- Its high intensity work but you never know when something might blast!
pros:
People here at Paytm are very driven for a common goal - One million orders will happen here first.
The pace at which we work is both maddening and exhilarating . The best part is that people here are judged upon their work and not experience , you might be one month old into the company but you can be driving an entire project. The office parties are fun and its like being in college and being paid !
cons: Since people here work at 150% torque all the time , the stress can sometimes become overbearing. Also, since priorities change round the clock , there's no roadmap but just a hike in the dark.

headline: Good for learning but work life balance sucks
pros:
1. You will learn on very new technologies and scalability.
2. Startup culture. You can directly talk to CEO and VP of company. 
3. Fun loving enviornment. You can see CEO playing songs in the company.
4. You own and are responsible for a whole module. Which you might not be able to find in big companies.
5. Flexible timings.
cons:
1. Huge Salary difference b/w people at same level and experience.
2. No hirearchy and middle management. Without hirerarchy, it is impossible to communicate and your work gets unnoticed.
3. No work life balance. You are expected to work 24*7.
4. No process being followed. As the company is growing bigger, they are still not following the processes and always busy in playing blame games.
5. HR is not present. Even if some HR are there, they are very dumb and not contributing to anything, be it recruitment or it employee-welfare.

headline: One97 (Paytm)
pros: nice work culture, flexible timings, young team, opportunity to grow fast.
cons: Very low on salary. no extra salary for over time

headline: Paytm: Excellent Company to start you're career with.
pros:
Sense of responsibility, hands on production experience . Not a formal office culture. Everything remains quite transparent. You'll find yourself sitting right next to the VP Engineering, the ceo taking a walk and talking to you.

While some may consider this as a flaw, I think for a startup, it helps staying in touch with the vision of the company.

Its fun working off hours, having pizzas and coke while you're making a feature live. I don't think bigger companies offer this kind of culture.
cons: Work-life balance can sometimes take a toll. It depends on person to person how they balance this.

headline: Challenging and satisfying Job

headline: Healthy Workplace
pros: It has been a learning experience. Have developed a lot of skills and the best part is , you get hands on with the production servers at initial levels itself. The culture is lively; it's a workplace where you can balance everything. People are humble and ready to help. It's a place rife with erudite, passionate,sincere and fun loving people. Your market value increases as after working here, you develop and hone skills to an extent that you can give a good competition in the Industry.
cons: At times , you might feel higher management is not acknowledging you work. But it happens rarely.

Totally enjoying the team outings and the bonds I have made here. Playing in the company's cricket league nowadays and am surprised at the dedication and discipline of all the teams. Probably reflects what we do in the office.
cons: I have seen some neighbours cribbing about things. I believe there is no smoke without fire.

headline: Worst Experience so far

headline: Autocratic company with incompetent management(specially paytm)
pros: seriously nothing good here except VSS
cons: too much of office politics. This review is specifically about paytm. They have more HR and Product managers than entire engineering team. The management takes pride in being super quick in decision making but that is not more than the pretext of hiding incompetent and indecisive nature. Fire employees at will and publicly abuse their employees. Its a fact that there are very few employees who have stayed for more than a year in paytm.

headline: Good company to work

cons: being a mobile service provider, not using latest technologies of mobile, still working on old structure of development, more focus on business rather than quality, not impressive products, not any famous product in VAS market
